profile.title: Basic info
profile.intro1: Your tutor profile is your chance to market yourself to students on Live Tutor. You can make edits later on your profile settings page.
profile.intro2: New students may browse tutor profiles to find a tutor that fits their learning goals and personality. Returning students may use the tutor profiles to find tutors they've had great experiences with already.
profile.alertUploadMessage: Please upload a professional photo. See guidelines

cv.title: CV
cv.info: Students will view this information on your profile to decide if you're a good fit for them.
cv.alertMessage: In order to protect your privacy, please do not share your personal information (email, phone number, social email, skype, etc) in your profile.

placeholder.interest: Interests, hobbies, memorable life experiences, or anything else you'd like to share!
placeholder.education: Example: "Bachelor of Arts in English from Cambly University; Certified yoga instructor, Second Language Acquisition and Teaching  (SLAT) certificate from Cambly University"

teach.alertMessage: This is the first thing students will see when looking for tutors.
teach.title: Who I teach
teach.introduction: Example: "I was a doctor for 35 years and can help you practice business or medical English. I also enjoy teaching beginners as I am very patient and always speak slowly and clearly. "

lable.target: I am best at teaching students who are

placeholder.introduction: Example: "I was a doctor for 35 years and can help you practice business or medical English. I also enjoy teaching beginners as I am very patient and always speak slowly and clearly. "

video.title: Introduction video
video.detail: Let students know what they can expect from a lesson with you by recording a video highlighting your teaching style, expertise and personality. Students can be nervous to speak with a foreigner, so it really helps to have a friendly video that introduces yourself and invites students to call you.

tip.title: A few helpful tips:
tip.t1: Find a clean and quiet space
tip.t2: Smile and look at the camera
